original_title: Son Volt: Live from Austin, TX
overview: After the breakup of the pioneering alt-country band Uncle Tupelo, guitarist and songwriter Jay Farrar founded Son Volt, which gave him a purer vehicle for his moody and compelling songs and rich vocal style. In 1997, as Son Volt were touring in support of their second album, Straightaways…, Farrar and bandmates Dave Boquist, Jim Boquist, and Mike Heidorn.  Track Listing  1 – Route  2 – Loose String  3 – Cemetery Savior  4 – Catching On  5 – Live Free  6 – Tear-Stained Eye  7 – True To Life  8 – Left A Slide  9 – Windfall  10 – Out Of The Picture  11 – Back Into Your World  12 – Ten Second News  13 – Picking Up The Signal  14 – Drown  15 – Too Early  16 – Chickamauga
title: Son Volt: Live from Austin, TX
